oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sue K. Hicks interview -- part A

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trials, litigation, etc.
Scopes, John Thomas; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpt of a video interview with Sue K. Hicks admitting that it was decided up front to try the case and that Scopes gave his permission to be part of it.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Department of Conservation Motion Picture Films, 1930-1965
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sue K. Hicks, one of the members of the prosecuting team at the Scopes Trial, was interviewed by Peter Bowman, Professor of the History of Science at the University of Tennessee at Knoxville, for the 50th anniversary of the trial.
